SEARCH
Package librarySE.utils

Class FileUtils

java.lang.Object
librarySE.utils.FileUtils
public final class FileUtils extends Object
Central JSON persistence utility for the Library Management System.

This class provides:

  • Reading invalid input: '&' writing JSON files safely using Gson
  • Automatic backup of files before overwriting
  • Polymorphic serialization/deserialization of LibraryItem
  • Custom serializers for LocalDate and LocalDateTime
  • Helpers for obtaining data paths and typed list definitions

All methods are static â€” this class cannot be instantiated.

Example Usage


 Path file = FileUtils.dataFile("items.json");
 List<LibraryItem> items = FileUtils.readJson(file, typeToken, new ArrayList<>());
 FileUtils.writeJson(file, items);
Author:
Eman

  • Method Details

    • writeJson

      public static <T> void writeJson(Path file, T obj)
      Writes an object to a JSON file. If the file exists, a timestamped backup is created before overwriting.
      Type Parameters:
      T - object type
      Parameters:
      file - the destination path
      obj - any serializable object
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if writing or backup fails

    • readJson

      public static <T> T readJson(Path file, Type type, T defaultValue)
      Reads and deserializes JSON from a file.

      If the file does not exist or JSON is invalid, returns the provided default value.

      Type Parameters:
      T - return type
      Parameters:
      file - JSON path
      type - expected type token
      defaultValue - return value if missing/invalid
      Returns:
      parsed object or default value

    • dataFile

      public static Path dataFile(String name)
      Resolves a file inside the data directory.
      Parameters:
      name - file name
      Returns:
      resolved path

    • listTypeOf

      public static Type listTypeOf(Class<?> clazz)
      Creates a generic List type token.
      Parameters:
      clazz - element class
      Returns:
      List type token
